verses.verse: Then the priest shall stand the woman before the LORD, uncover the woman’s head, and put the offering for remembering in her hands, which is the grain offering of jealousy. And the priest shall have in his hand the bitter water that brings a curse.

And the priest shall put her under oath, and say to the woman, “If no man has lain with you, and if you have not gone astray to uncleanness while under your husband’s authority, be free from this bitter water that brings a curse.
But if you have gone astray while under your husband’s authority, and if you have defiled yourself and some man other than your husband has lain with you”—

then the priest shall (Josh. 6:26; 1 Sam. 14:24; Neh. 10:29) put the woman under the oath of the curse, and he shall say to the woman— (Jer. 29:22) “the LORD make you a curse and an oath among your people, when the LORD makes your thigh rot and your belly swell;
and may this water that causes the curse (Ps. 109:18) go into your stomach, and make your belly swell and your thigh rot.” ‘ (Deut. 27:15-26) Then the woman shall say, “Amen, so be it.”
‘Then the priest shall write these curses in a book, and he shall scrape them off into the bitter water.
And he shall make the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and the water that brings the curse shall enter her to become bitter.
(Lev. 8:27) Then the priest shall take the grain offering of jealousy from the woman’s hand, shall (Lev. 2:2, 9) wave the offering before the LORD, and bring it to the altar;
and the priest shall take a handful of the offering, (Lev. 2:2, 9) as its memorial portion, burn it on the altar, and afterward make the woman drink the water.

When he has made her drink the water, then it shall be, if she has defiled herself and behaved unfaithfully toward her husband, that the water that brings a (Deut. 28:37; Is. 65:15; Jer. 24:9; 29:18, 22; 42:18) curse will enter her and become bitter, and her belly will swell, her thigh will rot, and the woman (Num. 5:21) will become a curse among her people.
But if the woman has not defiled herself, and is clean, then she shall be free and may conceive children.
‘This is the law of jealousy, when a wife, while under her husband’s authority, (Num. 5:19) goes astray and defiles herself,
or when the spirit of jealousy comes upon a man, and he becomes jealous of his wife; then he shall stand the woman before the LORD, and the priest shall execute all this law upon her.
Then the man shall be free from iniquity, but that woman (Lev. 20:17, 19, 20) shall bear her guilt.’ ”
(The Law of the Nazirite) Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

“Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When either a man or woman consecrates an offering to take the vow of a Nazirite, (Lev. 27:2; Judg. 13:5; (Lam. 4:7; Amos 2:11, 12); Acts 21:23; Rom. 1:1) to separate himself to the LORD,

(Lev. 10:9; Amos 2:12; Luke 1:15) he shall separate himself from wine and similar drink; he shall drink neither vinegar made from wine nor vinegar made from similar drink; neither shall he drink any grape juice, nor eat fresh grapes or raisins.
All the days of his separation he shall eat nothing that is produced by the grapevine, from seed to skin.

‘All the days of the vow of his separation no (Judg. 13:5; 16:17; 1 Sam. 1:11) razor shall come upon his head; until the days are fulfilled for which he separated himself to the LORD, he shall be holy. Then he shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow.
All the days that he separates himself to the LORD (Lev. 21:1-3, 11; Num. 19:11-22) he shall not go near a dead body.
(Lev. 21:1, 2, 11; Num. 9:6) He shall not make himself unclean even for his father or his mother, for his brother or his sister, when they die, because his separation to God is on his head.
((2 Cor. 6:17, 18)) All the days of his separation he shall be holy to the LORD.

‘And if anyone dies very suddenly beside him, and he defiles his consecrated head, then he shall (Lev. 14:8, 9; Acts 18:18; 21:24) shave his head on the day of his cleansing; on the seventh day he shall shave it.
Then (Lev. 5:7; 14:22; 15:14, 29) on the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of meeting;

and the priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and make atonement for him, because he sinned in regard to the corpse; and he shall sanctify his head that same day.

He shall consecrate to the LORD the days of his separation, and bring a male lamb in its first year (Lev. 5:6) as a trespass offering; but the former days shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.
‘Now this is the law of the Nazirite: (Acts 21:26) When the days of his separation are fulfilled, he shall be brought to the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
